lead_paragraph: Floyd Landis will find out if he can reclaim his 2006 Tour de France title on Monday, when the Court of Arbitration for Sport said it would announce the result of a five-day hearing held in March. Landis appealed to the court after an arbitration panel in the United States ruled in September that he used performance-enhancing substances during his victory. He was stripped of his title and Oscar Pereiro was declared the winner.
